alert.note: Alert for Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 11:27PM EDT until June 02 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR SOUTHERN MORRIS AND NORTH CENTRAL SOMERSET COUNTIES... At 1127 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in portions of Somerset County. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Morristown, Dover, Madison, Hopatcong, Florham Park, Hackettstown, Chatham, Wharton, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Mendham, and Stanhope. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 25 and 31. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 26 and 40. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
